intro: Bunium korovinii, commonly known as Siberian fennel, is a flowering plant native to the cold climates of Siberia and Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs such as parsley and carrots. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a mild, anise-like fragrance. Bunium korovinii is often found in rocky or alpine regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
